description: The protagonist, Masaru, has just inherited a big fortune after the death of his father. However, people are trying to get their hands on it by any means necessary, even if it means killing him. Narumi helped Masaru from being kidnapped after fighting some weird guys. He found out that they're not humans but wooden puppets with amazing strength. After a hard fight, Narumi was forced to admit that he's no opponent for them; and just when he started to think that Masaru would be captured, Shirogane, Masaru's watcher arrives from France with a weapon, the puppet Arlequin. Here, begins the story of Karakuri Circus.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

node.description:
He graduated from Nihon University. Fujita Kazuhiro made his professional manga debut in Shounen Sunday in 1989. He is most famous for the manga Ushio and Tora, for which he won Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen in 1992 and the Seiun Award in 1997, and the long-running Karakuri Circus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ufujitakazuhiro)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

**[Madhouse Profile](http://www.madhouse.co.jp/special/mhpf/mhpf_no028.html)**

**Inoue Toshiki** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

He graduated from Nihon University. Fujita Kazuhiro made his professional manga debut in Shounen Sunday in 1989. He is most famous for the manga Ushio and Tora, for which he won Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen in 1992 and the Seiun Award in 1997, and the long-running Karakuri Circus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ufujitakazuhiro)

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

name.native: バンプ・オブ・チキン

node.description: __[Website](https://www.bumpofchicken.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/boc_official_)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/BUMPOFCHICKEN)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bumpofchickenofficial/)__ __Introduction:__ BUMP OF CHICKEN, alternatively nicknamed バンプ (BUMP), and otherwise abbreviated to BOC (__B__UMP __O__F __C__HICKEN) is a four-piece Japanese rock band under record label TOYS FACTORY (2000-), having previously been under record label HIGHLINE RECORDS (1998-2000). Since their formation back in 1994, they have released eight albums and twenty-three singles. Their releases through the time became quite popular in Japan, seeing as every release since their third single, "Tentai Kansoku", has managed to reach the top ten in the Oricon Weekly Charts. Their music has also been used in various video games and as theme thongs for movies, television shows and anime. The band's name has its initial meaning from 弱者の反撃 (which when translated means _counterattack of the weak_). __Biography:__ "Let's form a band and change the history of rock.", suggested 14 years old Hideo Masu to classmate and friend Motoo Fujiwara during their 2nd year at West Usai Junior High in 1994. Along with the two other childhood friends, Hiroaki Masukawa (g) and Yoshifumi Naoi (ba), they saved up their money to buy instruments; Fujiwara even says he saved up his lunch money instead of using it to buy food. However, due to his strict parents, Fujiwara asked Masukawa if he could hide his guitar at his house instead of bringing it home. Their first performance was in 1994, during their ninth grade cultural festival, where they would play a cover of The Beatles' version of "Twist and Shout". At first they just played covers like this, but later they began writing their own songs that were in English. In 1996, their song "Danny" won a prize on 96TFM. They were only 17 years old at the time. In the same year they also won more awards with the song "Glass no Blues" and even released a demo tape during a live performance in 1997, which sold out in a whopping 10 minutes. The band, however, was put on hold while the members attended college... BUMP OF CHICKEN resumed activities in 1998, and in the year 1999 they released their first album, "Flame Vein". They also released their first single, "Lamp", later on in the same year. In the year 2000, the band saw their first promotional video for "Glorious Revolution", and the release of their second album "The Living Dead", as well as the release of their second single "Diamond". This was also the year that they did their first tour. In the year 2001, their popularity was on the rise with the release of their third single "Tentai Kansoku". This song caught the attention of the public, becoming an incredibly popular song. Their third album titled "Jupiter", released the following year, enjoyed good sales from this new popularity. In the following years came more live tours, more singles, and then came 2004. On August 25th 2004, Bump of Chicken proudly released their fourth album, Yggdrasil. Interestingly enough, Fujiwara himself did the album art for this CD, as he did with The Living Dead. The song Sailing Day, featured on this album, was used in the anime movie One Piece Movie 4: Dead End Adventure. (Contination of their biography can be read here: [wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bump_of_Chicken)) __Members:__ [Motoo Fujiwara](https://anilist.co/staff/103926/Motoo-Fujiwara) （藤原基央） Motoo Fujiwara "FujiKun" is the composer, lyricist, guitar, and main vocalist of the group. He has written most of the music, and has also drawn the artwork for their albums 'The Living Dead' and 'Yggdrasil'. Hiroaki Masukawa （増川弘明） Hiroaki Masukawa "Hiro" is the guitarist of the group, and also writes most of the hidden joke tracks for albums. He is referred to as the shy member of the group, and calls himself pessimistic. Yoshifumi Naoi （直井由文） Yoshifumi Naoi is the bassist of the group, and is referred to as the "crowd pleaser". Also known as Chama. He jokes that he "falls ill exactly four times a year." He also calls himself an anime and game otaku, and a "rare genius". Hideo Masu （升秀夫） Hideo Masu is the drummer for the band. He describes himself as an introvert. He also mentions that he has good eyesight, cannot write kanji well, likes to go outdoors, and often gets headaches. (Sources: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bump_of_Chicken), edited | [JMusicAmerica (archived)](https://web.archive.org/web/20071221233334/http://www.jmusicamerica.com/us/database-artist.php?id=153#), edited)
A prolific freelance animator known for working on a large number of shows at any given time.

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).

**Inoue Toshiki** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/増田敏彦)

Affiliated with [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).
**Shimoda Hisato (下田久人)** is a Japanese episode director, storyboard artist and production manager.

Initially worked as an animator in the '90s, but then left the industry and worked as a magazine editor at [Yuuichirou Oguro](https://anilist.co/staff/195642/)'s company. Made his return to anime in 2004. He wrote a few scripts in the early '00s, but has since shifted his focus to mainly storyboarding and directing episodes.

**Birthplace:** Tomakomai, Hokkaido, Japan

**Aoyama Hiroshi (青山弘)**, alternatively known by his pen name Kawai Yumeo (河合夢男) is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
